element.name: 36 A Walk in the Garden-The Coffin Stone by Kili or bust, Traditional Cache (1.5/3.5)
element.long-description:
Visit The Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE
Great granite portal
Glistening with the light
Of a million mirrors in which I
Can see the rituals of druids
And falcons from ancient forests.
And a young celt whispering
Through the heather to meet
A dearly loved one like you.
You the bedrock of my soul!
(old Gaelic text translated)
The Coffin Stone is a megallithic portal tomb under which some human remains were apparently found some years ago. It is quite an imposing lump of rock and I would hate to think of the poor souls that may have had to lift it at some point! I find it difficult to imagine too many people living out here in the wilderness back in those times but I presume people did hunt deer and other game around here. Also, I think it may have looked a lot different, with plenty of natural forests of various indigenous and perhaps deciduous kinds.
If you manage to trek up here around April May time then listen out for the arrival of a cuckoo or two. Also, plenty of ravens twirling and "flipping." If you are lucky you may spot a peregrine or a red kite. There are also kestrels about and all sorts of buntings, larks and willow tits. The forests throughout the trek are full of finches, strikingly beautiful chaffinches in particular.
The cache is placed close to the Coffin Stone itself which lies near the saddle between Djouce Mountain (approx 800 metres down from Djouce trig point) and War Hill.
The OSI map also shows an ancient Standing Stone nearby but I must say that I was unable to find it.
The illustration above shows a trekking route from Crone car park which can take in quite a few good caches. You would indeed be treated to some spectacular views throughout this trek, weather permitting!
Do not start the trek without all the proper mountain rain gear, waterproof boots and the guidance material, compass, map, GPSr with mapping etc.
Please note that all parts of this cache are hiked at your own risk. The cache owner takes no responsibility of any sort for any reason including accidents or mishaps.
Please be aware that cars parked in areas close to walking trails are vulnerable and they can be vandalised or stolen. Unfortunately this is an ongoing problem which is extremely difficult to solve, so there is a risk involved.
Please observe the country code to the best of your ability. Local landowners often generously allow access to upland areas across or through parts of their private property. Please, please be conscious of this and return the courtesy by keeping all gates closed, immediately and not on your way back!. Please use the gates where appropriate but if you have to climb over them then use the hinged side ONLY.
Please do not cause any damage of any sort to fences or barriers along the way.
element.url-name: 36 A Walk in the Garden-The Coffin Stone

ul.li:
2010-06-12T19:00:00Z : Found it by daraconn
After a short break on War Hill, it was an easy walk across to the Coffin Stone. I had been there often enough for picnic stops while out in the hills (perfect peaceful place to sit on a sunny day, when Djouce summit can get crowded), but never gone on to War Hill.
This stone is huge and is surrounded by smaller similar stones - granite unlike the schist cone that forms the summit of Djouce. My impression is that it was never moved very far - if at all - and was used opportunistically as the capstone of a portal tomb that was effectively built around it in situ. The name "coffin stone" probably refers to the shape.
There is no standing stone, and in fact the fictional standing stone doesn't appear on my (4th edition) discovery sheet 56. It seems to have resulted from a mistake where the coffin stone was shown as "standing stone" and then later both were shown.
The cache has rolled in quite deep, so you need to stick your arm right in!

2010-05-27T19:00:00Z : Found it by didi2206
What a great cache... I've been up so often but never bothered to head over this direction.. thanks for bringing me bringing here!!! So sunny and dry lately- gorgeous walk!

2010-05-18T19:00:00Z : Found it by Toffee Man
My second of the " walk in the garden series ". Clouds were gathering in & view was not so good today. Ah well - we had the hike & found the cache - now on to Djouce. TFTC Toffee Man #346

2010-05-18T19:00:00Z : Found it by Shailaja
Found on a hike with Toffee Man. Nice hide - hiked by here many times before and never paid any attention to the tomb before so it was nice to learn something too :) TFTC Shailaja

2010-05-13T19:00:00Z : Found it by theswerve
Found after a group doing compass work moved on...took a few minytes searching....TFTC....

wpt.name: GC277GZ
wpt.desc: 36 A Walk in the Garden-The Coffin Stone by Kili or bust, Traditional Cache (1.5/3.5)
